entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 11 at 4:30PM AKDT until July 11 at 11:00PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 11 at 4:17PM AKDT until July 12 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNINGS FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING REMAIN IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222, 223, AND 224... .DISCUSSION... A thermal low pressure trough stretching from Eagle to Ft Yukon to McGrath will persist through Tue, then move east. A moist and unstable airmass along this trough will cause scattered thunderstorms across the Eastern Interior

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 3:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Severe Thunderstorms Possible This Evening... Scattered thunderstorms are occuring across the Eastern Interior east of Tanana, and will continue through this evening. Some of these thunderstorms will have large hail, brief heavy downpours, winds gusting to 30 mph, and frequent lightning. entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 1:13PM PDT until July 12 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE LATE EACH EVENING THIS WEEK... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore Monday evening into Monday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas each year.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 11 at 3:37PM EDT until July 12 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers will be heavily swamped by waves. Waves will build to between 3 and 5 feet Tuesday morning, diminishing to 1 to 3 feet by late in the afternoon.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 11 at 10:33AM CDT until July 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High temperatures around 107 degrees expected. * WHERE...Palo Duro Canyon State Park. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heat related illnesses increase significantly during extreme heat events.

entry.title: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 11 at 2:47PM MDT until July 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with temperatures up to 102-104 expected. Overnight temperature will only recover to the mid 70s to near 80 degrees, especially over the urban landscapes. * WHERE...Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains, Tooele and Rush
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 11 at 2:47PM MDT until July 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Temperatures up to 100 expected, with overnight temperatures only dropping into the mid-70s, especially over urban landscapes * WHERE...Utah Valley.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 11 at 2:24PM PDT until July 12 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures of 95 to 101. * WHERE...Clarkston, Pomeroy, Gifford, Clarkston Heights, Lapwai, Culdesac, and Lewiston. * WHEN...From Noon to 9 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may lead to heat illnesses.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 11 at 1:28PM PDT until July 12 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures 99 to 102 expected. * WHERE...In Washington, Yakima Valley and Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington. In Oregon, Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...From noon to 9 PM PDT Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Yakima Valley

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 11 at 1:28PM PDT until July 12 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures 100 to 105 expected. * WHERE...In Washington, Lower Columbia Basin of Washington. In Oregon, Lower Columbia Basin of Oregon. * WHEN...From noon to 9 PM PDT Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 8:03PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Milwaukee, northern Walworth, northeastern Rock, Racine, southern Waukesha, southern Jefferson and northern Kenosha Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 802 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near St. Francis to near Wales to near
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jefferson; Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine; Rock; Walworth; Waukesha
